answers.answer: Hello.Can you mention if you have got your blood work for diabetes done? We are just trying to rule out some common causes of neuropathy.It is quite possible that there may be a nerve impinged in your lower limb. This will be evident on a clinical examination and MRI of the lower (lumbar) spine.To add, migraine is known to be associated with such symptoms throughout the body. But if you have it on a regular basis and have controlled your headaches with medication, it is better to look out for other causes.Regards

question: Along with headaches that make me sick ( i posted in the Migraine section) my husband tells me my legs twitch all night while i sleep, along with snoring and sometimes i wake myself up to my legs twitching. Lately ive noticed my left leg will feel like some on sprayed me with cold water and i keep reaching down to feel if my pants are wet behind my knee, its like my brain is playing tricks on me! What is going on here?
title: leg sensations
